learning_outcomes.description: identify plants using different types of keys
find resources to help you to identify plants
know terminology relating to plant characters
collect, preserve and store plant specimens

assessments.due_date:
7/10/2025 1:00 pm

Presentations to be held during Week 11.
assessments.task_description:
There are two choices of assessment:

1) Heathlands assessment using data from field trip (written assessment)

2) Adopt a rare plant species (delivery of slides by due date, and then oral assessment with a 5 minute presentation and 5 minutes for questions during Week 11)

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submission of the Written Assessment and Slides must be submitted by the due date and time provided. Online submission by Turnitin only by the due date and time. No hard copy or assignment cover sheets are required. Submission via email is not accepted.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Plant collection and key to collection
assessments.task_description:
Collection of a herbarium of 25 identified plants from a single habitat and an accompanying key to the collection.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You must submit your collection in the Practical in Week 12.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Students will be presented with fresh plant specimens to test identification skills. The exam involves identifying and answering questions about live plant material.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Plant Collection

Students are to prepare a herbarium collection of 25 flowering plant specimens from a single habitat.

Students will be responsible for collecting and identifying their specimens outside of class hours
learning_activities.topic_description: Plant Collection Students are to prepare a herbarium collection of 25 flowering plant specimens from a single habitat. Students will be responsible for collecting and identifying their specimens outside of class hours
